PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Nevertheless , this performance is more than double of the highest PCE ( 1.1% ) reported to date for μmR - polymers , even when the spectral mismatch in the NIR region above was considered.

Let's think step by step.

The "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

1. 1.1% - the highest PCE (power conversion efficiency) reported to date for μmR-polymers.
2. μmR-polymers - the type of polymers being referred to.

The paragraph is comparing the performance of the polymers being discussed to the highest PCE reported to date for μmR-polymers, which is 1.1%. Therefore, 1.1% is a property value that is being used as a reference point for comparison. Additionally, μmR-polymers are a type of polymer that has a specific property (PCE) that is being discussed in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of a material property:

1. 1.1% - the highest PCE (power conversion efficiency) reported to date for μmR-polymers.

The entity "μmR-polymers" does not directly refer to a material property, but rather to a type of material. Therefore, it is not relevant in this context.

So, the only entity that refers to the value of a material property is:

1. 1.1% - the highest PCE (power conversion efficiency) reported to date for μmR-polymers.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the valid entity presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 1.1% |

The entity "1.1%" refers to the highest PCE (power conversion efficiency) reported to date for μmR-polymers.
